docs.lead_paragraph: When Augie Hong awoke with severe abdominal pain nearly two years ago, he went to the hospital emergency room closest to his home in San Francisco. The diagnosis was acute appendicitis, and doctors removed his inflamed appendix. Mr. Hong had health insurance, so he wasn't too worried about paying. Then the bills started to arrive.

headline.main: The Consumer: Confusion On Pricing At Hospitals Adds to Pain

docs.abstract: Dr Renee Y Hsia study in the Archives of Internal Medicine finds extreme disparity in the prices charged at American hospitals for routine procedures, adding to the confusion experienced by patients navigating the health care system. Drawing (M)0

docs.lead_paragraph: A Government Accountability Office report urges the administration to cancel the program, which pays bonuses to health insurers.

headline.seo: G.A.O. Says Medicare Test Project Is Wasting $8 Billion
headline.main: G.A.O. Calls Test Project by Medicare Costly Waste
headline.print_headline: G.A.O. Calls Test Project By Medicare Costly Waste

docs.abstract: Government Accountability Office report finds that Medicare is wasting more than $8 billion on an experimental Affordable Care Act program intended to pay bonuses to health insurance companies providing high-quality care; urges Obama administration to cancel the program.
docs.snippet: A Government Accountability Office report urges the administration to cancel the program, which pays bonuses to health insurers.

docs.lead_paragraph: The law against ordering drugs online from other countries hurts the uninsured and the underinsured, and should be changed.

headline.seo: The Wrong Way to Stop Fake Drugs
headline.main: The Wrong Way to Stop Fake Drugs
headline.print_headline: The Wrong Way to Stop Fake Drugs

docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Roger Bate, a resident scholar at the American Enterprise Institute, asserts that the law against ordering drugs online from other countries should be changed; proposes several steps that could be taken to curb the production of fake drugs, which are often sold through online pharmacies.
docs.snippet: The law against ordering drugs online from other countries hurts the uninsured and the underinsured, and should be changed.
